object.script:
-- Track the rate of battery and fuel consumption -- Display the rate and duration remaining for each in minutes
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function state_obj() return {prev=0,cur=0,rate=0} end
updateticks=property.getNumber("Update rate ms") * 60 / 1000 -- Ticks between updates, 60/sec batstate=state_obj() fuelstate=state_obj()
function update(state,v) state.prev=state.cur state.cur=v state.rate=(state.cur-state.prev) / updateticks * 60 -- Track rate in d/sec end
clock=0 function onTick() clock=clock+1 fuel=gn(1) bat=gn(2)*100
if clock>=updateticks then update(fuelstate,fuel) update(batstate,bat) clock=0 end sn(1,fuel) sn(2,fuelstate.rate) sn(3,bat) sn(4,batstate.rate) end
posx=property.getNumber("Pos X") posy=property.getNumber("Pos Y") function timestr(sec) if sec>=math.huge or sec<=-math.huge then return "--:--:--" else return string.format("%02.0f:%02.0f:%02.0f",sec/3600,(sec/60)%60,sec%60) end end
function onDraw() local str=string.format("BAT : %3.0f%% %+5.2f\n" .. "T : %s\n" .. "FUEL: %4.0fL %+2.2f\n" .. "T : %s\n" .. "RATES/MIN", bat,batstate.rate*60,timestr(-bat/batstate.rate), fuel,fuelstate.rate*60,timestr(-fuel/fuelstate.rate)) screen.setColor(0,0,153) screen.drawText(posx,posy,str) end

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function onTick() alt=gn(1) sn(1,alt)
speed=gn(2)*1.944 sn(2,speed)
temp=gn(3) sn(3,temp)
rotorrpm=gn(4)*60 sn(4,rotorrpm)
enginerpm=gn(5)*60 sn(5,enginerpm)
compass=gn(7) heading=(-compass*360)%360 sn(7,heading) end
rowh=6 function onDraw()
screen.setColor(0,255,0) local txt=string.format("ALT %4.0f KTS %4.0f\n" .. "HDG %3.0f\n\n",alt,speed,heading) screen.drawText(0,0,txt)
screen.setColor(230,0,0) txt=string.format("RPM %4.0f ROT %4.0f\n" .. "TEM %4.1f", enginerpm,rotorrpm,temp) screen.drawText(0,rowh*2+rowh-1,txt) end

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function dl(ax,ay,bx,by) screen.drawLine(ax,ay,bx,by) end
hfov=property.getNumber("hud h fov") hfovrad=hfov/180*math.pi hradscale=math.sin(hfovrad)
function onTick() compass=gn(1) bearing=gn(2) end
function onDraw()
local h,b,t,x local w=screen.getWidth() local hw=w/2
h=compass*math.pi*2 b=bearing*math.pi/180 t=(h+b)
x=hw+math.sin(t)/hradscale*w
screen.setColor(0,64,0) -- screen.drawText(0,0,string.format("%0.1f",hfov))
if x>=w or x<0 or math.abs(t)>hfovrad then if t>0 then dl(w-1,2,w-3,0) dl(w-1,2,w-3,4) else dl(0,2,2,0) dl(0,2,2,4) end else dl(x,0,x,2) end
-- center mark dl(hw,3,hw,4) end

object.script:
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function pgn(k) return property.getNumber(k) end
crossx=pgn("Crosshair X") crossy=pgn("Crosshair Y")
function onTick() cruise=gb(1) underammo=gn(1) sideammo=gn(2) end
crossleg=2 crossgap=3 hcrossgap=crossgap/2
function crosshair(x,y) screen.drawLine(x,y-hcrossgap,x,y-hcrossgap-crossleg) screen.drawLine(x,y+hcrossgap,x,y+hcrossgap+crossleg) screen.drawLine(x-hcrossgap,y,x-hcrossgap-crossleg,y) screen.drawLine(x+hcrossgap,y,x+hcrossgap+crossleg,y) end
colw=5 rowh=6 function onDraw()
local x,y w=screen.getWidth() h=screen.getHeight() --x=w*crossx --y=h*crossy
screen.setColor(0,64,0) crosshair(crossx,crossy) screen.drawText(0,h-rowh, string.format("%2.0f", underammo)) screen.drawText(w-colw*4,h-rowh, string.format("%4.0f", sideammo))
if cruise then screen.drawText(w-colw-1,h/2,"C") end end

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function clamp(n, low, high) return math.min(math.max(n, low), high) end
zoomq=5
function onTick()
sb(32,gb(32))
-- enabled=gb(3) -- if not enabled then return end gpsx=gn(1) gpsy=gn(2) compass=gn(3) hdg=(compass*-360)%360 waypointx=gn(4) waypointy=gn(5) bearing=gn(6)
sn(3,compass) zoomm=gn(32) sn(32,zoomm) zoom=zoomm/1000 halfkm=zoomm/2 end
zoom=1
function onDraw()
-- debug -- screen.setColor(255,255,255) -- screen.drawText(0,0,string.format("%.0f",scr))
-- if not enabled then return end w=screen.getWidth() h=screen.getHeight() cx=w/2 cy=h/2
screen.setColor(0,0,0) screen.drawClear()
screen.drawMap(gpsx,gpsy,zoom)
-- Draw self blip in center of map screen.setColor(0,255,0) local t=-compass*math.pi*2 screen.drawLine(cx,cy,cx+math.sin(t)*5, cy-math.cos(t)*5)
screen.setColor(255,0,0) screen.drawCircleF(cx,cy,1)
-- Draw waypoint blip screen.setColor(0,0,255)
local dx=waypointx-gpsx local dy=gpsy-waypointy
-- screen.drawCircleF(cx + dx * w / zoomm, cy + dy * h/zoomm, 2) wx,wy=map.mapToScreen(gpsx,gpsy,zoom,w,h,waypointx,waypointy) screen.drawCircleF(wx, wy, 2)
screen.setColor(0,0,255) local txt = string.format("BRNG: %3.0f\n%.0f, %.0f\n%.0fkm",bearing,gpsx,gpsy,zoom) screen.drawText(0,0,txt) end

function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function onTick() gpsx=gn(1) gpsy=gn(2) wpx=gn(4) wpy=gn(5)
local dx=wpx-gpsx local dy=wpy-gpsy range=math.sqrt( dx^2 + dy^2 )
local b=(math.pi/2) - math.atan(dy,dx) b=(b+(math.pi*2)) % (math.pi*2) bearing=b*180/math.pi
sn(1,bearing) sn(2,range) end
function onDraw() local msg msg = string.format( "BRNG\n%.0f\n\nRANGE\n%.0f", bearing, range) screen.setColor(0,255,0) screen.drawText(0,0,msg) end

node.label: Sweep azimuth

object.script:
-- Clock rolls over here clock_roll=9999999 clock=0 sweep_enable=false
function pgn(k) return property.getNumber(k) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
function intcomp(x,y) return math.abs(x-y) < 0.5 end
-- How long to remember a contact. The stock radars are probably supposed to do this given that they -- provide an age field, but stuff just blinks in and out instantly.Seconds. contact_dwell=pgn("Blip dwell") dwell_ticks=contact_dwell*60 az_mult=pgn("Azimuth multiplier") az_offs=pgn("Azimuth offset") sensor_type=pgn("Sensor type") -- 1=radar,2=sonar
-- range, azimuth, elevation,timestamp,which (source) contacts={count=0,array={}} lock=0
-- Treat floats as ints for comparison function intcomp(a,b) return math.abs(a-b) < 0.5 end
-- Calculate age of given timestamp in ticks function age(t) local d=clock-t if d < 0 then return clock_roll-t+clock+1 end return d end
-- Package up the contact list in an object function fetch_contacts(obj) local i, pos local entry
-- Clean out stale contacts for i=obj.count,1,-1 do entry=obj.array[i] if age(entry[4]) > dwell_ticks then table.remove(obj.array, i) if intcomp(i,lock) then lock = 0 end if i < lock then lock = lock -1 end obj.count=obj.count-1 end end
local noo local az for i=1,8,1 do if( gb(i) ) then noo=obj.count+1 pos=i*4-3 cont={}
-- Radar if sensor_type==1 then cont[1]=gn(pos) az=gn(pos+1) cont[3]=gn(pos+2) else cont[1]=math.huge az=gn(pos) cont[3]=gn(pos+1) end cont[2]=(az*az_mult+az_offs) cont[4]=clock
if have_locks and intcomp(lock, i) then lock = noo end obj.array[noo]=cont obj.count=obj.count+1 end end return obj end
blip_color={pgn("Blip R"),pgn("Blip G"),pgn("Blip B")} ord_range=0 ord_t=0 function onTick() enabled = gb(32) sb(32,enabled) --enabled=true
clock=(clock+1)%clock_roll if not enabled then return end
sweep=gn(28) sweep_enabled=sweep_enabled or sweep ~= 0 sweep=sweep*az_mult+az_offs
have_locks=gb(9) have_range=gb(11) if have_range then ord_range=gn(12) end lock=gn(4)
fetch_contacts(contacts) scale=gn(32) end
function radius(cx, cy) return math.min(cx,cy) - 1 end
function blip(cont, sc, cx, cy,color) local r = radius(cx,cy) local d=cont[1] local d2=math.min(d,sc) local pos
-- Draw a chevron pointing to blips outside the screen -- We will use this for sonar, too, since the range is unspecified pos=ray(cx,cy,cont[2],d2*r/sc) local bright=(dwell_ticks-age(cont[4]))/dwell_ticks *.76 screen.setColor(0.24 + color[1]*bright,0.24 +color[2]*bright,0.24+color[3]*bright)
if d>sc then chevron(pos[1],pos[2],cont[2],5) else screen.drawCircleF(pos[1],pos[2], 1.25) end end raypos={0,0}
-- Calculate the endpoint of a ray based on an origin, a theta in whole circles, and a length function ray(x,y,t,l) local t2=math.pi*2*t raypos[1]=x+math.sin(t2)*l raypos[2]=y-math.cos(t2)*l return raypos end
function chevron(x,y,t,l) local pos=ray(x,y,t+0.5,l) screen.drawLine(x,y,pos[1],pos[2]) end
red={0,255,0} function draw_contacts(conts,scale,lock) local i local r,g,b b=0
for i=1,conts.count do blip(conts.array[i],scale,cx,cy,blip_color) end
if have_locks and not intcomp(lock,0) then blip(conts.array[lock],scale,cx,cy,red) end end
scale=1000 function onDraw()
if not enabled then return end w=screen.getWidth() h=screen.getHeight() cx=w/2 cy=h/2 r=radius(cx,cy) screen.setColor(0, 255, 0)
-- draw the sweep line if it's active if sweep_enabled then local pos=ray(cx,cy,sweep,r) screen.drawLine(cx,cy,pos[1],pos[2]) end
-- Draw the ordnance range ring if active and it offers that datum if have_range and age(ord_t)<1 then screen.setColor(0,16,0) screen.drawCircle(cx,cy,ord_range*r/scale) end draw_contacts(contacts,scale,lock) end

-- To avoid consuming channels, we dedicate a LUA script to reusing an allocated -- channel to convey the current heading and subtract it out of all of the azimuths -- so that contacts can be overdrawn relative to north, since it makes sense to overlay -- radar over the map, but there is no way to rotate the map and it is always north-up.
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function sb(n,v) output.setBool(n,v) end
function onTick() -- To avoid consuming channels, we dedicate a LUA script to reusing an allocated -- channel to convey the current heading and subtract it out of all of the azimuths -- so that contacts can be overdrawn relative to north, since it makes sense to overlay -- radar over the map, but there is no way to rotate the map and it is always north-up.
local i scale=gn(32) heading=gn(32)
for i=1,32,4 do sn(i,gn(i)) sn(i+1,gn(i+1)-heading) sn(i+2,gn(i+2)) sn(i+3,gn(i+3))
sb(i,gb(i)) sb(i+1,gb(i+1)) sb(i+2,gb(i+2)) sb(i+3,gb(i+3)) end sn(32,scale) end
function onDraw() end

object.script:
collective=0
function gb(n) return input.getBool(n) end
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sc(r,g,b) screen.setColor(r,g,b) end
coldead=property.getNumber("Collective axis deadzone") colinc=property.getNumber("Collective increment per sec")
function sign(x) return x>0 and 1 or -1 end
function clamp(x,l,h) return math.max(math.min(x,h),l) end
function onTick() turbinerpm=gn(27) colax=gn(30)
-- If the gyro is active, it doesn't understand sticky axes with a deadzone. -- It will be sending a straight analog collective value, so pass it through. if gb(30) then output.setNumber(4,colax) else if math.abs(colax)>coldead then colax=colax-coldead*sign(colax) collective=clamp(collective+colax*colinc/60,0,1) end output.setNumber(4,collective) end end
function onDraw() end

object.script:
function gn(n) return input.getNumber(n) end
function sn(n,v) output.setNumber(n,v) end
function clamp(x,l,h) return math.min(math.max(x,l),h) end
function onTick() x=gn(1) xset=gn(2) y=gn(3) yset=gn(4) heading=gn(5)*math.pi*2 box=gn(6) rollscale=gn(7) pitchscale=gn(8)
local xcorr=clamp(xset-x,-box,box)*rollscale/box local ycorr=clamp(yset-y,-box,box)*rollscale/box local droll=math.cos(heading)*xcorr+math.sin(heading)*ycorr local dpitch=math.cos(heading)*ycorr+math.sin(heading)*xcorr sn(1,droll*rollscale) sn(2,dpitch*pitchscale) end
function onDraw() end
